body.p: Born in Virginia circa 1810. Married Sarah E. Mallory. Director of the Kentucky State Agriculture Society. Pallbearer at the funeral of James S. Jackson in Louisville in October 1862. State Senator from Jefferson County in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1864. Murdered by Union soldier J. House in Louisville on July 27, 1864.
